Headline: #21 Cermak Temporary Reroute at Cermak/Archer
ShortDescription: 21 Cermak buses are temporarily rerouted via Cermak, Archer, Canal and Cermak due to, street blockage near Cermak/Archer.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
#21 Cermak buses are temporarily rerouted via Cermak, Archer, Canal and Cermak due to, street blockage near Cermak/Archer.

Allow extra travel time.

Headline: #86 Narragansett/Ridgeland Temporary Reroute at Narragansett/Cortland
ShortDescription: 86 Narragansett/Ridgeland buses are temporarily rerouted in both directions near Narragansett/Cortland.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
#86 Narragansett/Ridgeland  buses are temporarily rerouted in both directions via Narragansett, Grand, Central, North Avenue, Ridgeland, and resume normal route, due to street blockage near Narragansett/Cortland.

Allow extra travel time.

Headline: Temporary Westbound #55 Garfield Reroute near Garfield/Princeton
ShortDescription: Westbound 55 Garfield buses are temporarily rerouted near Garfield/Princeton.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
Westbound #55 Garfield buses are temporarily rerouted via Garfield, Princeton, 51st, Halsted, Garfield and resume to normal route, due to street blockage near Garfield/Princeton.

Eastbound buses are not affected.

Allow extra travel time.

Headline: Loop 'L' Service Delayed near Clark/Lake
ShortDescription: Loop 'L' trains are standing near the Clark/Lake due to a signal problems.. Crews working to restore service.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
Loop 'L' trains are standing near the Clark/Lake due to a signal problems.

At this time, also consider other service alternatives that may serve your trip, such as nearby bus routes, or using buses to other rail lines.

Personnel are working to restore service. Allow extra travel time.

Headline: Service Between 54th/Cermak and Polk, then Racine (Blue Line) Stations, Only
ShortDescription: Pink Line trains operate from 54th to Polk only, then connect w/Blue Line at Racine for continuing service, due to signal problems near Clark/Lake.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
Pink Line trains operate from 54th to Polk only, then connect w/Blue Line at Racine for continuing service, due to signal problems near Clark/Lake.

As a result, Pink Line trains are running as follows:

  • Between 54th/Cermak and Polk, and then are diverted to Racine on the Blue Line for direct connections at Racine to continuing Blue Line train service to/from downtown.

Using connecting Blue Line service:

  • For service to downtown from Pink Line stations between 54th/Cermak and Polk, take a Pink Line train toward the Loop and stay on board until the train reaches Racine on the Blue Line. Transfer to an O'Hare-bound Blue Line train from the same platform for service into downtown.

  • For service from downtown to Pink Line stations between Polk and 54th/Cermak, take a Blue Line train toward Forest Park to Racine. Stay on the same platform side and wait for a 54th/Cermak-bound Pink Line train.

Shuttle buses are also available between Polk and Ashland to provide connections to continuing Green Line service.

Other possible alternatives may include: 

  • #9 Ashland
  • #21 Cermak
  • #49 Western
  • #50 Damen
  • #52 Kedzie/California
  • #53 Pulaski
  • #54 Cicero
  • #60 Blue Island-26th
  • #82 Kimball-Homan
  • #94 South California
  • #157 Streeterville-Taylor buses

...including to/from and in combination with other 'L' services.

Note that if you take a bus to/from the Pink Line, you may also be able to connect to/from the Blue Line's Forest Park branch or Green Line along Lake Street directly via that bus route.

See station personnel for further assistance, and pay attention to announcements on trains and at stations for service information.

We are working to restore service as quickly as possible. Allow extra travel time.
